bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lord Dawson, April 5, 1937

div1.p: Hench regrets that Dawson cannot attend the ceremony and suggests postponing the event to a later date.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lord Dawson, April 5, 1937
div1.opener:
April 5, 1937
Lord Dawson
32, Wimpole Street, W. I.
London, England
My dear Lord Dawson:
div1.p:
I was so sorry to receive your letter on
my vacation in Florida and to learn that it
is impossible for you to come to the United
States next fall. I am sure that Dr.
Hutchison will be deeply disappointed and
I am inclined to feel that he may try to
postpone the entire affair until it is
possible for you to come. I know that he
is counting on your coming and is very
anxious indeed to have you present if at
all possible. I hope that I shall hear
that another date can be arranged with mutual
satisfaction to you and to the college.
div1.closer: Yours sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:FN
